content.prompt: Which of the following most accurately describes the role of the British cabinet?

choices.label: The cabinet formulates, implements, and enforces policy through different agencies.
The cabinet exclusively oversees subnational units of governments such as states and regions.
The cabinet is a central part of the judiciary because they do research for judges.
The cabinet inhibits democratic procedures because it has the power to veto or delay bills passed by the House of Commons.

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Describe political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors of a course country.
